title: Understanding Kinetic Energy
text: Remember that kinetic energy is related to the motion of particles. At a given temperature, the average kinetic energy of gas particles is the same for all gases.

title: Temperature and Kinetic Energy
text: The average kinetic energy of gas particles is directly proportional to the temperature. This means that at the same temperature, different gases will have the same average kinetic energy.

title: Molecular Mass and Speed
text: While the average kinetic energy is the same, the speed of the molecules can differ. Lighter molecules move faster than heavier ones at the same temperature.

title: Comparing Different Gases
text: When comparing different gases at the same temperature, focus on the fact that their average kinetic energies are equal, regardless of their molecular masses.

title: Final Consideration
text: Given the same temperature, all gases have the same average kinetic energy. This is a fundamental principle of kinetic molecular theory.
